message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.COMM, cs.MA, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper deals with power allocation and antenna selection in high-speed railway communication systems, which involves optimizing the use of limited resources to transmit information. This falls under the purview of information theory. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses the optimization of communication systems in high-speed railways, which is a networking problem. 
3. cs.COMM (Communication and Networking): The paper deals with communication systems in high-speed railways, which is a core topic in communication and networking. 
4. cs.MA (Multiagent Systems): The paper considers the problem of dynamic time-domain power allocation and antenna selection, which involves coordinating multiple agents (i.e., antennas) to achieve a common goal. This falls under the purview of multiagent systems. 
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper deals with the optimization of a complex system (i.e., the high-speed railway communication system) by controlling its inputs (i.e., power allocation and antenna selection). This falls under the purview of systems and control.
